column5: I purchased the Beatrice Stripe/Heritage Green color in this beanie as a gift to match my girlfriend's Bright Grass colored Marmot Ama Dablam down jacket.  It matches it perfectly, has a nice fleece lining to keep your ears warm on the slopes,  and has the fitted beanie look with no bagginess.   I would definitely recommend it!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: A great mid layer or as a stand alone jacket for the town or trail. It won't block rain or snow, but the synthetic insulation still retains heat if it does get wet. This pullover version adds a bit of comfort and cleans up the front.  I do wish it had hand pockets or a pouch though.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I would have gave this 5 stars but it just don't fit me that good. I'm 5'8" 175lbs. I ordered a medium first and it fit everywhere but the chest. i sent the medium back and ordered a large. The large is to big in the waiste and way to long in the arms. I'm keeping the large because I like the jacket. This jacket is not made to fit stocky guys.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: Got this as a gift, feedback was - Love it.  Incredibly light, incredibly thin.  Heats up really quickly and cools down enough if need be with a varying level of zip.  Adds no weight to the pack, can wear it casually, looks like a million bucks.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I love this jacket, it's super lightweight, but still quite warm, and looks awesome. Normally I would wear a Large in most jackets, but I wear a Medium in Patagonia, as their sleeves run long and the relaxed fit works well.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This thing is light and warm!  Fits true to size and feels great.  It’s very packable for when you need to shed some layers while hiking or for throwing in your touring pack.  I bought a Patagonia Torrentshell Jacket to wear over the Nano Puff when it rains in the fall or early spring.  They work perfectly in combination with each other.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I love this jacket. I am unfortunately between sizes and had to size up so it fits a little loose.  Still makes for a great layering piece and provides the protection needed without sacrificing weight.  The long front zipper allows for dumping heat and I feel like I am able to regulate my temp fairly well in this jacket and not take it off every time the sun comes out.   The fit is a little boxy.  The front pocket is great but it weighs down the front of the jacket and rides up on your neck.  These definitely don't outweigh the positives of this jacket. Highly recommend.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: The weight of this pullover is great for many different uses. It's light enough to wear casually on a cool night, but the insulation is such that it's also perfect for cold conditions if you're moving at all. I like to wear it under a shell as an insulating layer when skiing. It's comfortable enough to sleep in when camping, as well. The stow pocket lets me pack it down (grapefruit size) and toss it in the pack when on the go. I like knowing that Patagonia will repair it at their facility if I ever do manage to tear it.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I actually have the special edition, but the functionality of the piece is the same. The only difference was the outer material on the special edition is slightly lighter. It is incredibly warm, whether as a layering piece or an outer layer and is wind and water resistant. It is pretty nifty in the sense it can pack into the chest pocket, or you can just stuff it into the nooks and crannies of your pack to maximize space. The fit is pretty spot on as well, I am 5'8", 170lbs and went with a medium. I can throw it on over a hardshell or wear it as a layering piece and still not feel like the michelin man or feel overly squeezed. I have a patagonia hooded merino 3 and a Patagonia super cell pac lite hardshell on underneath the nano puff in this picture
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: ...if you buy this, you'll wear it all the time. Great jacket for anything and everything from backpacking to casual Fridays in the office.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Awesome jacket.  Perfect for layering because it is lightweight and low profile.  Its a jacket you can wear outside and leave on in the  house and never get too hot or too cold.  It's not a slim fit but it's not too bulky either.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Wore this inside for a few hours on a chilly day, and it was perfectly comfortable. Great "shirt."

This is an awesome lightweight option for fall/spring hiking, biking, and just everyday use. It isn't crazy warm, which is to be expected, because it is called a shirt, not a jacket, but I've found it makes a great outer layer on warmer days, over a sweatshirt or flannel. Patagonia usually runs a little bit big, as I'm usually a Large for my long arms to fit, but the medium is perfect in this! Overall I love it, construction is top notch, and I'm going to be wearing this waaaay too much this winter!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Love this jacket. It's lightweight, comfortable, and keeps you warm in cold weather.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This jacket is warm. Low profile and looks nice
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Bought this as a gift for my son-in-law.  Here is what he has to say about it....  I must wear this jacket or take it with me everyday. When it is cold it keeps me warm and when it is that in between cold and hot the jacket does a great job at just keeping me comfortable. I have actually worn the jacket in 75 degree weather and felt great. Super comfortable and lightweight.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I got this to serve as a warmer weather option, and it has done this for the short time I've had it.  The initial description had it with zippered pockets, but it does not.  Too bad, no place to definitively secure your keys or wallet.  I do however like the inside drop pockets.  I feel that although generally the sizing seems right, the hips are a bit snug.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: I returned this because it turns out I like my other Patagonia downs jacket better (http://www.backcountry.com/patagonia-down-sweater-mens?s=a)

I grabbed this jacket to keep in my backpack for the unpredictable temps that invariably accompany Des Moines in later-winter/early-spring (literally 70 and sunny on Saturday and 22 and snow on Monday) 

The Patagonia Down Shirt is super light, well made, and plenty warm for temps down to the mid-30's. 

My only beef (which is only due to the amazing quantity and quality of bacon and beer in Des Moines) is that it is built to fit really athletic climbers. It is broad in the shoulders and a little snug near the waist so it is a little snug around my artfully crafted beer belly.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Lightweight and highly pack-able.  Great for use in 40+ degree weather or as an extra insulation layer when it's colder.  Runs true to size; I ordered  a medium and am 5'10 / 180
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This is a fabulous jacket especially with Backcournty's price and service. However, it has to be returned as the medium was too small for my husband. He is 5'9" and about 170 with fairly broad shoulders. The jacket fit great through the waist but was too tight through the shoulders and the large will be too big.  Bummer.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: Funny that this puffy is called a "shirt." But so far, it's been good for cool, not cold, weather. Great quality, as always, with MHW. Looks great, too.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: This jacket is the perfect fit and size. Works great on those crisp fall and spring days with wind where it is light enough to keep you warm. Great for layering or on its own.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This jacket keeps you warm during the fall festivities even with just a t shirt under.  I got a medium which is what I usually wear for a shirt size and it fits perfectly. The only thing that I've noticed is that you can feel the down feathers poking you sometimes and you'll find feathers when you stand up ever so often, but that comes with the territory when buying a down jacket. Would recommend to friends. The orange is very bright too, prepare to get your balls busted.

I take this jacket everywhere with me, it is warm enough to deal with temps around 40F with moderate physical exertion. I use this as my primary "inside jacket", keeping me toasty while at rest. The packability of this jacket is also worth noting, as it can easily be added to a camelback for a cold ride or ski. Great purchase.

Note: I originally purchased a medium, knowing that I would be right in-between the two sizes, but I am solidly a size small.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Fantastic for cool nights. Lightweight and breathable, exactly as expected! I am usually a Medium, but in Patagonia a Small is best as they tend to run a little large. A great base layer with a shell as well.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: Size down unless you're a young Arnold.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This is a very versatile jacket that withheld up and down temps of Telluride.  Packs away nicely when you start getting warm and holds up in the cool Colorado mountain summer nights and mornings.  I'm 6'1" and skinny, so the small fit my frame decently in the torso.  The sleeves could have been a tiny bit longer but they still worked out.  It's a little tight around the waist with no elastic, but provided a a good seal.  Patagonia regular for items tend to be wide in the torso, which was the case with the medium I exchanged out.  Overall, very happy with the purchase.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: Perfect size for a cell phone, wallet, and keys. Really lightweight but was durable enough to handle a handful of moutain bike rides so far. Would definitely be perfect for a short jog or hike. not quite big enough for a water bottle but can fit one 12oz can of a beverage of choice.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: First off I dig the color selection of this pack. I got the purple and orange to pay homage to the 90s-era colors. The pack is quite small but easily fits a wallet, phone, keys, maybe some food. Definitely has capacity for a 12oz can of your choosing as well!!
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: I used this for a three week trip to Asia. It worked out awesome.  This pack is perfect for keeping all your important items in one place and safe.  I kept my money, passport, camera with extra batteries in this, and still had room. Light and comfortable to wear.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: This was smaller than I expected, but that is a good thing for me.  I only need room for iPhone, cash and a few essentials, comfortable to wear on hip or over shoulder.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I was looking for a quality fanny pack primarily for cross country skiing and shorter hikes and this Patagonia lightweight travel mini hip pack fit the bill perfectly.  The main drawback with this pack is that it doesn't hold a full sized water bottle so I had to purchase a .5L collapsible water bottle - no big deal.  I was debating getting the larger pack so it could hold more water but at that point I would just use my lightweight backpack.  The color is so bright and fun that I will use it when I attend concerts or any other event where I want to be hands-free.

This will not be a politically correct review. I love "hip" packs, so much so that I still call them "fanny" packs because that's what they used to be called when I first fell in love with them. My last such pack was fairly large, and while I thought it rocked, my bride (of now 20 years) decided early in our marriage that my fanny pack was totally gay (in a South Park sense, of course), and refused to let me wear it. I went with black with this little Patagonia pack (accessory Man Bag), and it's as small as it can be and still fit my wallet, my big i-phone, a couple protein bars, and a few other things. I love it. I wear it skiing, hiking, or just out and about outdoors, and while my bride kind of frowns, she can deal with it. Two big major thumbs up. Saved my marriage!! Now don't need to go shopping for a second wife who appreciates mini light weight hip packs, which are totally "hip." It's about 4" high and 7-8 inches wide. Love it!!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I'm not sure if it's just me but fanny packs should have never gone out of style. This is the greatest accessory that has happened to me in a while, it fits my wallet phone and a couple extra necessities, not to mention I think it looks pretty darn cool since Patagonia did a great job with the colors and fitting. I use it for running errands to simply running (because who hasn't struggled with where to put your phone when you want to listen to music but your wearing leggings that don't have pockets).
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Used this during the days in Europe. Easy way to carry small things without having to worry about being pickpocketed.

This works good for it's intended use which was to bring my cellphone with me on walks and runs with my dogs.... especially having an older dog who I sometimes think won't finish his walks. Thinking back on this purchase the price is a little high for what it is but I guess you're paying for the name brand.

Yayayaya! I love this. At first, I thought, "hmmm...how could this fanny pack differ from any other fanny pack?" I'll tell you how! Ample pocket space, padded and cushy underside, water resistant exterior, and the straps are incredibly easy to tighten or loosen. Sometimes I tighten them all the way up and hold it like a mini clutch. I love this thing. My main purpose for it is to make change when I'm selling art in festivals, but I know it would be just as killer one a hike to carry the essentials. I use it to carry my phone and wallet when I'm skateboarding. 10/10!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: This pack is the right size for ditching a pack or bag if you want to keep it minimal. There is room for even the plus sized phones as well as keys and anything else you might want to carry. For the biking side, it can hold a tube, co2 inflator or a compact pump, tire levers, as well as some gels or food too. Not too much extra room where it is flapping around on your waist while you are trying to do things which makes it nice.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Bought this fanny for my sis and she loves it! Fun colors and perfect size! Big enough to fit iPhone and essentials. She uses it on shorter hikes. She also said it is very comfortable to wear when hiking. Definitely a good go to fanny to holster your essentials on a short hike
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I wear these all over. Super comfortable, warm, and functional.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I bought these for my sister and likes them. She finds them cozy and functional, but wishes there was an option for fingerless for the thumb.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: Bought these for my sister and she said they are warm and comfortable and likes the option of open fingers.  While not for winter skiing they are great for lighter uses.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: Great gloves for every day use during cold winters! And the button for the mittens is adorable. Love these!

I walk my dog early in the morning and I was in need of a breathable, flexible, and warm glove. The fingerless aspect of this glove is great for using my phone, handling my pups leash, and anything else you would need your bare fingers for. 
So warm! So functional! I love them! 
P.S. *a great gift idea*
column8: I've used it several times

column5:
Everything Anne says is true - these gloves are incredibly soft and cozy, they keep me warm every morning on my commute! The finger holes are a teensy bit tight at first, but they definitely loosen up with wear. For reference, my ring finger is a 6 and the XS is comfortable! LOVE THEM (I went with the Birch White)!

Reach out with questions: agarofalo@backcountry.com / (800) 409-4502 ext. 4691
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: These gloves were a great purchase. I wear them nearly every day and I'm never cold, thanks to a thickly woven lining. Utterly wind proof. The only things to mention are that the finger holes are a bit tighter than expected - although still comfortable - and the thumb doesn't have an option to convert into a fingerless style, which is sometimes frustrating. Nevertheless, I love these gloves and highly recommend them!

I got this for my mom. She's never had one before, but I've had multiple and always love them. Be aware, though, that if you want to wear a tee shirt under neath, you might want to size up. Tee sleeves bunch and get uncomfortable if the sweater's sleeves aren't loose (not too loose, obviously) enough.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: This awesome jacket "sweater" is classic because of its simplicity, and extremely well designed and constructed.  Timeless--pick a color you love because you'll have it for a very long time.   It has structure to hold its shape, it cozy and warm, and I can wear it for activities or everyday casual; goes with everything.  I love the Birch White for versatility, but all of the colors are great.  This sweater has a place in ANY apparel collection for all different lifestyles and tastes.  I found I'm in-between sizes so I sized down and it's perfect.  While I don't want a skin tight fit, I definitely don't want a sloppy baggy fit so sizing down 1/2 size worked well for me.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5:
Bravo Patagonia! Bought this as a gift and she had this to say.  This is my favorite outerwear for any fall-winter activity, I wear it ranging anywhere from hiking through the canyon to sitting by the campfire on a cold night. I wouldn't take any other pullover I have previously worn over this on a ski day either. It is an everyday go to. 
the fleece inner-lining keeps you extremely warm and is baby bottom soft. the quarter zipper is long and this is easy to pull on and off. the color is fun, 
extremely durable as I have beaten the snot out of it and looks brand new still. I chuck it in the washer and dryer and hasn't shrunk either. I will end up most likely buying this in all of my favorite colors!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I followed the advice if other reviewers who said the sweater ran big and ordered an XS...its too small and will have to return for a S, my regular size..  Love the birch white color and the style and finish of the sweater, fabric is soft and feels like it will be really warm.  4 stars only because I haven't  actually worn it yet.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5:
This jacket is awesome, it goes with me everywhere. It's nice and warm. I bought the craft pink color and it's a beautiful vibrant pink. It's true to size - I bought a medium and most of my tops are a medium as well. 

I also wanted to give a shout out to the customer service at backcountry. They have been wonderful in giving me expedited shipping and following up afterwards to make sure I was enjoying the jacket and didn't have any other questions. I would definitely recommend them!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I love this Patagonia Better Sweater Jacket! It is very comfortable and keeps me very warm! It's perfect for layering on a cold day.  It fits true to size. I would highly recommend.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: A must-have! Great layering piece of wonderful on its own. I wear it skiing, camping, and around town. Great to wear under a vest and very warm. I was hesitant about a full zip because I'm more of a 1/4 zip person, but I think a full zip is best for this piece. Looks presentable enough to also wear to a casual dinner or work environment. The bottom of mine has slightly begun to curl up and it has gotten a little bally through washing it. However, you can use a tool and remove the balls if you would like.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I love this sweater. It has a good fit, not to loose, but not to tight and it  super comfortable. This sweater keeps you warm and is great for everyday wear or as a layering piece.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: While this jacket does run a bit big and can feel boxy sometimes, I absolutely love it. It is so warm and versatile, pockets are large enough to hold a phone or wallet, and it goes with everything. My first one I washed and dried after every other wear and it has started to pill. The other two I don't wash as frequently and don't dry and they have held up great.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I love the fit of this, not too baggy or too loose and a really great length.  Really warm and looks really good layered with a down vest.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I ended up returning this item- I love Patagonia but this fit was just not for me. It made me look boxy in areas and the zipper placements felt awkward on my arm/ made the fabric bulge. My normal size is a medium but I ordered a small (I lost my old one, navy blue/small about a year ago), but I decided to return it.
Gave it as a gift, you can never go wrong with this fleece, everyone loves it. Fits well,  so warm, and looks great.
This fleece will keep you warm. Easy to layer with a light layer, but nothing too thick.

Really warm and cozy. I usually like jackets with hoods, but this one is great with just the collar. The pocket on the sleeve is just big enough for an iPhone 5 or 6se, which is convenient for using with headphones or when you don't want to carry a bag around with you. I've washed it several times and haven't had an issue with it pilling, possibly because I hang dry it most of the time.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This is my 3rd better sweater...I'm a little obsessed. They're such great quality that I can't help but get another one when a fun color comes out! These are on the 'relaxed' fit side so I'd size down. They start to pill after several washes, but overall they hold up great. Love them!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Prefect for spring weather in Maine! Ordered size Small, fits true to size! Will buy more colors.
column8: I've used it several times

column5:
I am 5'3" and 135 lbs.  medium fits me perfectly.  
This jacket is perfect for early spring and late fall and all those in-between days.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: I love this sweater! I also have it in the half zip. The material is so soft, but looks a little dressier than most fleeces. It is great layer, I have even worn it skiing. The fit is very flattering with a longer fit and slightly fitted at the waist. This fleece runs true to size.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I ended up getting two of these for christmas by mistake and now have a small and a medium. I prefer the fit of the small but I can only wear it with a really light weight shirt so that it doesn't feel snug. The medium is slightly too big and feels sloppy around the waist.  While the fit isn't perfect, I still wear this jacket almost everyday. It works really well as an extra layer under my rain jacket.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: So warm and soft! I got a small, which is the size I normally wear and it fits well. I picked up the hemlock green and love the color. However, it is lighter in person than it looks on the screen.

I find Patagonia sizing to be inconsistent.  I bought this in a Small as I own other Patagonia items in a Small and this jacket in particular runs big.  I should have exchanged it for an XS but removed the tags and wore it out before realizing how big it looked.  I'll give it to my sister who will love it but make sure you size down.
column8: I've used it several times

column5:
I bought this jacket as a gift for my wife and it has quickly become one of her favorites. The fleece lining makes it very soft and warm, and even in the coldest climates up in the Pacific Northwest she can get away with wearing one base layer and this jacket and is very comfortable outside.

It fits true-to-size, and is the perfect length for her without feeling too bulky.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: You could definitely say I put this one through the ringer. I purchased this coat just before a 3 week long camping/road trip during late October. This jacket got me through some pretty cold nights in Wyoming and Montana. For two weeks we didnât see a single night above freezing. On colder nights that dipped into the 20âs and teens I would put on a sweater or light down jacket underneath, but most of the time a beanie, gloves, and a buff around my neck were the only other accessories I wore with this jacket. The length kept my bottom and thighs warm. The material serves as a decent wind block. Its durableâ

I love this jacket! I bought it as a Fall to early Winter jacket and have been in love with it ever since. The sherpa lining keeps me warm and the canvas outer gives it a cool casual feel. I get a lot of compliments on it and have been very pleased with the fit. I am 5' 7", 140 lbs and bought a size small, it still has enough room to wear sweaters under it.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I love this jacket! It is very comfortable and cute. I love the bear brown color way with the fleece hood, I do wish I had gone a size larger, the arms are a little snug. I know i won't be able to throw this jacket on over a sweatshirt.  I am 5'5 135lbs. I was too excited when it arrived that i couldn't bear to send it back wait!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I'm loving this jacket. The industrial green is a great color that fits perfectly into my wardrobe. I'm 6ft tall and usually wear a women's size 14 and the large fits me well. I feel that the jacket runs a bit large. I like an XL nanopuff and XL Patagonia rain jacket, but an XL in this jacket was too big. If you are on the fence with which size to order, size down. I could use an extra half inch or so of sleeve length but I'm not complaining because I'm tall and sleeve length is always a problem of varying degrees. I get lots of compliments when I wear this jacket and the only reason that I don't give it a full 5 stars is that I wish it had a two way zipper! It would be so great to be able to unzip from the bottom up.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I absolutely love this jacket. The green canvas is trendy and goes with everything and the sherpa lining is so cozy. It's warm without feeling bulky. I'm obsessed.
column8: I've used it several times

column5:
I love the coat, the color, the material.  It is very warm and I always get so many compliments.  Im a 30DD, so I was nervous about getting a small but very glad I did.  I am still able to where a sweater under the jacket and not feel constrained. 

I got the saddle color and it is just my style! Would totally recommend (and do) to anyone that asks. Very happy.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: This jacket is a serious everyday jacket. Fit allows for plenty of room for layering. Fleece lining in the body feels like a hug. I love the dual pockets so you can carry stuff and warm your hands separately. Pockets and sleeves have more of a silky feel.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: The quality is outstanding, the fit is perfect. And it's CUTE!! I've had many compliments already.

I needed a casual coat that was not a ski coat and not super puffy, yet warm.  This is so so warm and is so cute.  I get compliments wherever I go.  We bought one for me and now we just bought one as a gift.  New go-to coat! - Ben's wife
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I have been eyeing this jacket for 2 seasons. I got the large originally and it was HUGE on me, I am 5'6 and a 36 D and the medium ended up being the perfect fit. It is definitely a jacket for cold weather, it almost feels like you are wearing a fleece blanket but with a really cute outer shell.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: I bought this for my wife and it has since been her go to jacket. She wears it almost daily and it looks great with everything. The lining inside makes for a super warm jacket, without being bulky. Buy one for your wife.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I've been loving this jacket! It's super cute if you like the kind of over sized parka look. It's pretty long and hits me just a few inches above my knee. But the regular fit leaves a little wiggle room for layering underneath when the temp drops even more this winter! The fleece lining is really cozy too. Also the waist drawstring stays in place really well. Highly recommend this coat!
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: Nice jacket really warm looks really good quality work done on it!  Get it!

I gave this as a gift:

"When i am looking for a stylish, but casual and cute jacket, i always think of my Patagonia Prairie Jacket! The green is absolutely wonderful. Exactly as it looks in the picture. It has a super awesome cinch in the waist that helps it have a more custom fit. 
The sleeves don't have much insulation, but the body has a nice fleece on the inside. 
I love everything about this jacket."
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: I've either had light fall coats or heavy ski coats. I needed a casual winter jacket so I decided to give this one a try! It's worked wonderfully so far! I think the fit is great. I really like that the waist has a cinch as well as the hem of the coat. It makes it a little more flattering and form fitting and can cater to all sorts of body types within the sizes which I think is awesome! The sherpa lining is nice, soft, and cozy. The outer canvas material feels really durable and I feel will hold up over time! It's kept me nice and warm! It's really made the perfect casual get-around-town coat. The hood is great and is actually functional! It shields your head from the wind and the sherpa lining within the hood keeps your noggin warm. The only thing I don't like about this coat is that it bunches up around your waist/hips when you sit down which is both slightly uncomfortable and little unflattering. Really not that big of a deal to me, i'm just nit-picking. I pretty much wear this coat every day to and from work, around town, etc! It's been great for me and I would definitely recommend it.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5:
My fiancee was hoping this would be her go-to winter coat, but there were a few things she didn't like about it: 
-The fit! For my lady's broader shoulders and narrow hips, this jacket was tight up-top and a big ole bubble around her hips.
-The super casual style. The cotton-canvas outer has a cool look but is not very versatile- casual only! 

In the end we had to return this one and will probably purchase something waterproof and slightly more dressy. 

Feel free to contact me anytime with questions about Patagonia jackets.
Kyle L. - Expert Gearhead - klivingston@backcountry.com
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: Just received my coat, "Down with it Parka. " I ordered an extra large for layering and am glad I did.  I have a heavy sweatshirt under it and it fits perfectly.  Im 5'7" and 150 lbs.  .  I can see this coat going to the opera, as well as, our cottage.  I am a little dissapointed the Patagonia label isnt on the front but, I guess this way it's dressier.  Overall, Im very happy.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: I bought this jacket in navy because the grey one was sold out last winter. I believe black, navy, or grey would all look great on you! This is the warmest down jacket yet stylish and soft. I wear a turtleneck sweater underneath, and it fits well; however, if you want to wear a thicker sweater or feel like more room under it, I recommend you to size up. I receive compliments every time I wear it. I am buying another one in Large grey this year and will update my comments on it. Patagonia holds its name well.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This jacket is perfect for the coldest days! When i was reading reviews, a lot of people were complaining about the bulk. I would say its all a preference, but i love the extra warmth and extra length on this jacket.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: This jacket is warm and classy!

It is a beautiful jacket, that does indeed keep you very warm. Before making my purchase, I read all of the reviews, I decided to go with a size small, I am 5'3" 127lbs size 28-29 hip measurement (Just had a baby), with that being said the jacket fit perfect, but left very little room to comfortably add layers underneath. I will agree with some of the other reviews, it was snug in the arms/chest area. Although I was able to zip the jacket up with no problem, I just felt that there was little room to have active movement (I felt to be tight if I had to bend over, pick up kids, or go on a walk with the dogs). After much thought, and since it is an investment piece, I decided to exchange it for a Medium. I contacted customer service and was not disappointed. They were extremely friendly and helpful and  because of this experience, I will happily order from this company in the future.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: I ordered this one and the Mountain Hardwear Downtown Down Jacket, to compare which one I would like better. I ended up going with this one. The arms on this jacket seemed to have more down and a little bit warmer. The fit was more flattering, and the all around quality was just a little bit better than the Mountain Hardwear. It is a little bit more so you're paying for that quality. Overall a great jacket!

I was looking for a coat to keep me warm when I move from NYC to Chicago, where I'll probably be walking outside a good distance to the train. I ordered this one and a higher-rated but slimmer and more expensive competitor coat to try on both.   Cons: The Patagonia coat felt like I was wearing a sleeping bag, and looked not far off that. It lacked style and wasn't flattering to me personally.  Pros: The hood fits nicely and doesn't blind me.  I'd imagine it would stay put in wind, too. Also, this coat is WARM. Nevertheless, given the other coat was slimmer and just as warm, I decided to return this one. If you're looking for a coat for hardcore outdoor cold weather, and you care less about looking slim or stylish, go for this one!
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: I bought this for my girlfriend as a Christmas present. She absolutely loves it, it's stylish, warm and as she would say it goes great with her wardrobe.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I love this Jacket. it is Patagonias warmest Women jacket available. it fits perfect to size, but the only thing that sometimes bugs me is the bell bottom. Wish it was more slim at the bottom, but i can understand the purpose of it being how it is now.
Love the fit and the warmth. Perfect for a NYC winter.

This is nice coat but really wish it  had cuffs.  Also it feels quite tight in arms and chest, though otherwise quite puffy. Thought about trying larger size, but was worried that the rest of coat would be too big-- and I really want cuffs.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: I'm 5'9" and usually wear a small or medium. I love the length of this coat and I love that the arms are long enough to cover my gloves! It's super warm and  very light. If feels like your in a down sleeping bag! The olive color is very appealing! Wore it out today (18 degrees with 20 mph wind and snowing) only had a long sleeve shirt on underneath and was toasty! When I wear layers under it I stay warm but don't get over hot. It's so worth the money! I took a long time making a choice and I'm so happy with this purchase!
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: Beautiful jacket and wonderful Patagonia quality in all details. I am returning unfortunately as it's too snug under the arms and across the shoulders. I am 5'7" 127 lbs with semi broad shoulders but no chest :). The medium is perfect and not too puffy.

Gorgeous coat, but runs very small. I normally wear a size 14  in most coats. Ordered this in XL and it's a very tight fit over a thin shirt, so have to return it.  I own another Patagonia jacket in XL and it's a loose fit over a sweater.  Very disappointed that Patagonia sizing is not consistent.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: This is the only jacket I've ever had that has kept me toasty warm in Northern Michigan winters! I was plenty warm when it was 15 degrees out with strong wind. It is very lightweight and not bulky at all like most winter jackets. So happy with this purchase!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I purchased this coat at the beginning of the winter after being displeased with a similar coat of a different brand. I cannot say enough things about this coat! It is super warm, very true to size, and as figure flattering as a winter coat can be!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This is a great warm around town jacket.  For those of us who live in the mountains with cold weather most of the year, this jacket keeps you warm while out and about.  The down is insulating while not being terribly puffy and big.  The cut is slimming and flattering.  Zippered and lined pockets keep hands warm and small items secure while zipped up.  The hood is functional and fits well allowing you to see what's going on while wearing it.  Overall it's a must have winter piece.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I received my Patagonia pebble gray jacket today and it fits perfect.  I purchased the large.  I am 5'6 and 150 lbs.  My arm length is 33" and this jacket fits perfect in the arms and back and all around with a small  exception on my chest area.  I am a size 38 and a full C cup.  On my chest its a little snug but I think I can handle it.   An Extra large would be to big.   This jacket does not make me look fat.  It's flattering. Hope this helps girlfriend.

I bought the pebble grey coat. I LOVED the color. It is super warm and comfortable. I think it's a perfect size. However, I returned it because 1 - it's super puffy and not flattering and 2 - I was afraid of it getting dirty quickly.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: This coat is warm but not heavy/bulky. Fits true to size and figure flattering. I'm short (5'1") and it's true knee length on me. I've been wearing it in the sub-zero wind chill days in Chicago and I'm so glad I have it!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5:
Great product! 
usually an XL but had to exchange for L.
Soft and warm for the thickness.
Wish there were side pockets
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5:
I was searching for some simple but high quality christmas gifts that would last my family a few years -- so naturally I chose some Patagonia sweaters! My dad is your very typical track suit wearing Eastern European, and he can be really picky with his style of clothing. He wears the same colors (navy, black, white, grey, dark greens) and the same style for as long as I've known him (23 years). He's so simple with is wardrobe its' actually hard to shop for him! 

I looked at the Patagonia Better Sweater knowing it was the very same thing he always wears -- a collared 1/4 Zip Fleece. But my dad's usual collection of fleeces don't even compare to the look (classic!) and sustainability of Patagonia products. After speaking to my mom who was sick of seeing him in drab colors, I took a risk and bought him one in Classic Red (he's not a bold colors person) size medium, and my dad loved it! The Medium fits him perfectly, and it fits right in with his wardrobe while standing out as one of the nicer pieces he owns. 

Two thumbs up!
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: Ah. The Better Sweater. What can I say? I'm wearing it right now as I type this. I might die in it. Who knows. It's not coming off.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I bought this as a gift for my cousin that is an avid skier and is always in search of a fleece jacket that he can layer while on the mountain. The color (industrial green) looks just like the picture and it fits him true to size - he wears a small in almost all jackets and hoodies. He has already worn it on the slopes and said it was great to wear over a base layer and under a shell, and after a few runs he could pack his shell away and just wore this the rest of the afternoon.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5:
pros:
-warm
-nice colors
-good quality fleece (although the material will develop "hiker's stink" over time, which cannot be removed by washing)

cons:
-no pockets
-quite expensive compared to other brands ($100 for a pullover with no pockets? c'mon)
-runs HUGE in the waist, like unwearable unless you have a big gut to fill it out
-return policy from Backcountry is awful
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: Fabric is very soft and comfortable, runs true to size, perfect for cold weather but not completely waterproof or wind resistant. Wife always steals it.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: I bought this in the nickel color for my boyfriend. Color is great and it is stylish for going out. Only thing is it is the wind goes through it. So good to wear with something warm under.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: Bought it as a gift and was too large. Backcountry boasts a world class return and exchange policy.... but they charge you 6.99 for shipping. The sweater was the same price on other website that have better 2017 level customer service. I would recommend avoiding this site if you are gift buying.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: This is the warmest article of clothing I own, yet I can wear if all day at the office and outside comfortably down to 30 F.  It's cozy, looks great and I got a stellar deal buying it from Backcounty. A+.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Only con: runs a tiny bit large
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Bought this as a gift for my brother and he loves it!: "I could not be happier with the use I am going to get out of it. I have been in need of a warm sweater that is durable and casual enough to wear when doing outdoor activities, but also sophisticated  enough to wear around the city and into work. The pocket on the chest is a great spot to keep an energy bar and/or your phone,  This pullover keeps me warm but is breathable, and the ability to unzip around the neck area is a luxury."
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This is such a great jacket! For sure one of my best
Not only does this sweater look cool, but it performs well as well. It truely does keep you warm while being stylish. 10/10!!
Gave this as a gift, so warm, looks great. You can't go wrong buying this fleece

I loved my better sweater so much that bought a his and hers set for my parents for Father's/Mother's Day. Love the feel, fit, the quality, and most of all to support an awesome company like Patagonia.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5:
Man. This is a piece that I had eyed for years before finally purchasing, even though I knew all along just how I'd feel when it arrived.

It's pretty much a perfect piece. Incredibly soft, and I mean incredibly, on the skin side. The super soft fleece touches the skin, while the outside is brushed smooth like a sweater.

I recommend getting in an every day color like grey, navy, black. That way, you can wear it anywhere and everywhere. Personally, I don't take mine camping or hiking, it is a bit heavy for that, thought performance wise there's no question it's burly and technical enough to keep you warm without getting trashed in the bushes. Mine is more of an around town piece, from work to the movies to the coffee shop... airports to libraries to Christmas morning. This thing looks nice, feels nicer, and is made by a company that cares for the environment and future generations. Can't go wrong.

Bravo Patagonia! This is my favorite outerwear for any fall-winter activity, making me feel like i'm braving an iceland storm. I wear it ranging anywhere from hiking through the canyon to sitting by the campfire on a cold night. I wouldn't take any other pullover I have previously worn over this on a ski day either.  It is an everyday go to.
the fleece inner-lining keeps you extremely warm and is baby bottom soft. the quarter zipper is long and this is easy to pull on and off unlike some others (spyder) that are tight under the arm. the two tone color is fun, and the zip pocket on the chest is easy to access and plenty large enough for a phone and small wallet. 
extremely durable as I have beaten the snot out of it and looks brand new still. I chuck it in the washer and dryer and hasn't shrunk either. I will end up most likely buying this in all of my favorite colors!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: After I purchased a 1/4 Better Sweater for myself  I knew I had to share the love so I picked one up for my boyfriend as well. I can vouch that this is one of my favorite pieces to wear in the winter, I basically never take it off and it is still so comfortable and looks great. I have no doubt that then men's version of this fleece will be the same. I definitely earned some serious brownie points with this gift as it has become the go-to fleece for my man as well as me.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This is great for early mornings or to layer.  I bought an XL to wear as a stand alone if I wanted to only layer this piece I would have bought an L.
column8: I've used it several times

column5:
I love this sweater and I find myself wearing it on almost a daily basis.
Super warm! Warmest sweater you will own.
The sweater is reinforced in all of the important places ~ arm cuff, elbows, waist, collar.
It is a very typical  Patagonia garment and it is an athletic fit. If you know how Patagonia clothes fit you, you'll have no problem with this sizing. It does not run large, it just doesn't run fitted.
I highly recommend this product. You'll get your money out of it!

column5:
Arm length is long ~
I bought it as a husband gift. Thank you for your kind support.

column5: I wear this sweater straight from the ski hill to apres. Warm and classy on the more casual side but works great for hiking or skiing. I wear a medium but could have also gone with the large, I like my cloths a little on the tighter side and this seems to run just a hair large.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5:
bought the better sweater in XL, fits kind of tight. all other XL fit me, returned it.
I bought a down sweater a few years ago in XL, I kept it but it also fits kind of tight. Does Patagonia sizes run small?
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: So as a shorter/stockier guy, Patagonia products have often not been a good fit for me. Where I might need a size "S" length for sleeves or body length, I'll usually need size "M" to fit properly in the chest and/or waist area. This better sweater actually fits great in a size "S" all the way around. I tried the M first, assuming i'd need it, but the M ran pretty large by my measure, and was a little baggy around waist and chest. S was a perfect fit for me. For thinner guys, definitely consider sizing down compared to other Patagonia products.  Apart from that, the quality and comfort are what you'd expect from Patagonia and I love that it's something I can wear to the office just as comfortably as in base camp. Only complaint is that the ladies' version has a sleeve pocket whereas the men's version has a napoleon pocket. I actually prefer the functionality of a sleeve pocket over a napoleon pocket, but not a huge deal and definitely not a deterrent to owning it for me.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This is a terrific fleece sweater from Patagonia that is stylish, comfortable and warm.  I purchased the women's version for me and thinking my boyfriend might like one, purchased a men's large as he is 6'2'', 215 lbs and has broad shoulders from lifting and triathlon. Unfortunately, he found the fit of the (regular) Better Sweater too boxy around his torso, even while trying it on with a t-shirt, so I suspect he would prefer the more form-fitting (Performance) Better Sweater jacket instead.  This still looked great, so if you like a more loose fit for layering, I recommend this.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: I wore this jacket in temps ranging from the low 60s to the high 30's, and i never felt too warm or cold. It also looks great with with jeans or work out clothes. I'm 5'6" 160lbs, and the SM fits almost perfectly. I own other patagonia jackets so i'm confident this one will last a long time.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5:
This jacket is so great for winter. Keeps you warm no matter how cold, and yet somehow never too hot.
Take extra 20% OFF coupons from coupon-code.info
Patagonia's Better Sweater line is amazing. They're incredibly versatile, cozy, and easy to wear. The jacket is no different.
My wife is the ultimate critic when i comes to clothes and she loves it.  Comfortable and warm as well.  Highly recommend
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: It's no wonder you see many people sporting these; they're great. They keep you warm and are super stylish. Really happy with this purchase!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: My go-to sweater when the weather is chilly/cold outside. Plus, I always get compliments on it! I highly recommend getting yourself one of these.

column5:
The classic Patagonia Better Sweater can't be beat. Quality material, great fit, awesome to wear on it's own or as under another jacket on colder mornings.

Would highly recommend!

column5: feels and looks great! Thank you back country for great customer service. This isn't a slim fit but it does look nice and true to size.

column5: The Patagonia Better Sweater is the on of the best tops I own.  The fit is excellent and true to size.  I can wear this in the fall as my outer layer.  I will wear it to work and not feel over or under dressed.  Did I mention it's the perfect layer for my ski days?  I'll probably buy a few other colors and put them in the rotation.
