Bought as a gift for my wife. About this skirt she says, "Beautiful color; fun, sassy skirt that is elegant and comfortable. Great for around town, playing with my kids, and work. You can't go wrong with this skirt. The asymmetrical hemline makes it fun, the shorter end falling right at the knee."
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: Soft material true to size very comfortable.

This dress is light weight and flows so nicely. The fabric is very soft. It's very comfortable and so great that it can be a skirt or a dress. It's like buying two items for the price of one! Love, love, love this drirt! Or is it a skress?
i like the color and the pattern. it's cute with a black tank top for spring break. it runs a little small

I got this item for a friend in a medium and the fit was fine, weather wearing it as a dress or a skirt. The material is very soft and comfortable, making this the perfect piece for tropical climates. She found this dress/skirt to be very versatile... worn as a dress it is perfect for coming and going from the beach for the day, then as a skirt paired with a cute top for a dinner out! Easy! Love the dark blue color too.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I really like this skirt, it's comfortable and versatile. But, I have one from last year/season and I wear a SM with room to spare. In this year's version, I could barely get the small on, I tried a few to be sure,  so I had to switch to  MED.  Weird, but ok otherwise.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I had my eye on this skirt all summer, and finally ordered.  I am on the short side (5 feet, 2 inches), and was worried about the skirt version being too long.  I have found that it is just right, however!  I love the variable hemline, it lets me wear it in different ways.  All in all, a good purchase, and I look forward to wearing this for a number of summers to come.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I really like the Kamala skirt. It falls at just the right length and has just a touch of hippy flare. It washes up well. I have not used it as a dress...I am too old for that! Nice and cool on a hot summer day. I bought the navy blue version
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Oh wow, this skirt is great!  I love it just as a skirt, but I did try it out tying it up as a halter dress, and it's not sooo baaaad!!!  I have the 'glass blue' color, the one with neon yellow, pink and blue in it.  It's exactly what I could have hoped for...  Maybe more!!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I love this skirt! It is very flattering! fits very well! Always looks great!! Ordering more for work!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Bought this in navy, great comfortable skirt to wear around the beach and for travel when you need to pack light! I didn' t get a chance to use it as a halter this trip but will be sure to give it a try next time!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: The pattern and fabric are cute and versatile! I'm a teacher so it's perfect to wear to work with tights underneath. The dress fits really well and as a skirt it's a little tight around the hips but still fits decently. It's great for work or for wearing out!
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: I've owned skirt/dress combinations before, and usually while the skirt is fine, the dress has as much style as a paper bag.  This is the exception - the skirt flow nicely and the dress is actually shaped well (you'll actually have a waist).  I'm not a small person, and the dress kept even "the girls" up where they belong due to the handy neck tie.  Great for travel!
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: I bought this skirt for me wife because she liked the way it looked in the pictures.  When she got, she tried it on and the fit and length were fantastic.  However, she ordered the pink color based on the way it looked in the picture and we were surprised to find that it seemed about 3 times as bright as it does in the picture.  Other than that initial shock, it's a great skirt.  She says that it's comfortable and easy to wear.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: Was hoping to wear this as a skirt, but found it to be WAY too long. I am 5'2" and it hit me about 6 inches above my ankles. Was hoping that I might be able to wear it as a dress, but the seam on the side of the skirt and becomes the center of the dress made an awkward shape. I loved the pattern (Nakashima stripe teal) and the fabric, but ended up returning the item because it wasn't flattering at all.

Ive bought several Patagonia board shorts and this one by far seems to be the most durable. The material seems a bit tougher than some of their other models and definitely seems like it would last for many summers to come! The material is still very comfortable and the length of the short is awesome. Its just right above the knee but not too short. I used this board short all summer and it worked great for me.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Fit great, mine has lasted since 2000 with hard use - scuba, whitewater raft trips, kayaking, tubing, etc. If he stops growing they look to last just as long as mine.
column8: I've used it several times

column5:
Mens boardshorts are all over the place. I have yet to find a standard size or fit, and thats why im hyped on these shorts. 

Perfect fit for me in a size 30, especially for my skier legs which can be difficult to squeeze into narrower shorts. The amenities are great. These shorts have a  secure lace tie, durable suit material, and the thigh high pocket is a superior design and as far as i know exclusive to this brand. I sport my board shorts to the gym, beach, and kayaking and because these are so on point they will be my first choice from now on. I got the Piton Paradise/Channel Blue and they look exactly like the photo.

Totally recommended and i'm coming back for more.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I've had my Wavefarer's for a couple years now and they've held up perfectly.  They've resisted fading, still have the same great fit as when they were new and haven't given me any signs of chafing.  My favorite part is how quickly they dry - especially with the included elastic loop in the pocket for hanging.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Doesnt feel like im wearing anything, and its great! Ive worn them for a near 12 hours and they never bunch up or rub uncomfortably against the skin. One zippered pocket is all you need, and the elastic loop that attached onto my keys were a great added security. They were great as hiking shorts when I went a few miles to get to some swimming holes and hot springs. Id highly recommend them, may even get a second pair
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: These are a great fit, period. Designs as you see them online and a soft material that makes you want to wear them everywhere. Scott is wearing them in Florida and being an athletic and thinner build he wore what he usually wears a 34x21.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: I bought these as a gift for my brother and this is what he had to say: "These are easily my favorite board shorts. The material is comfortable and fits well on the waist. The hip pocket is perfect for easy storage of chapstick and a GoPro. They dry quickly.
column8: I've used it several times

column5:
These are some awesome straight up board shorts, They have an amazing around the knee length and not to baggy . These also have an awesome pocket and great lacing system to find your perfect fit. 

They fit true to size,  im a 33 waist but prefer something something a little big and thee 34 are perfect
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I have only worn them a couple times so far but I think they are a great pair of board shorts. I like the look a lot for just a plain old day at the beach or lake. I would however, say that I like the Patagonia light and variable board shorts more overall but especially for traveling and hiking. I believe they have more of the stretch previously mentioned and I love how small they pack up.

Picked these up and love the fit and feel of the shorts. The DWR coating is unique on a pair of board shorts, although I have found it very useful in situations where I got hit with water but didn't want to get wet or was on abrasive ground. Not wanting to get your board shorts wet is somewhat of a rare occurrence but for those certain instances it can be very beneficial. The shorts are reliable in terms of durability so you don't have to worry about abrasion from sitting on rocks before you're jumping that 40 footer. I've tried both the 21 inch and the 19 inch. The 21 inch still sits above the knee for me at 6'1. Definitely would recommend for chill summer vibes. Like Louis said it would be pretty sweet if they had some amount of stretch to them. Perhaps in future models.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: These are classic patagonia shorts, fit well, durable as hell and look great.  They have a good sized side pocket to hold your phone, keys, cards and a great zipper.  Although these are extremely durable and will last forever, I wish there was a little more stretch in the product for maximum comfort.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I constantly buy these.  They are my favorite.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I can't wait to buy more for everyday use. No lines, comfortable, and they wash up well in the back country.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I bought these as part of a matching set with the barely bra, and not only are they really cute, but they're super comfortable.  The fit is super flattering, and doesn't show under leggings. These have become part of my favorite underwear set and I will definitely be buying more in the future.
column8: I've used it several times

column5:
This is what she had to say. 
These underwear are soft and comfortable as can be. I went with XL by accident when I ordered them I did not make sure what size I had clicked on . Lol ( it was a long day that day) anyway I will definitely buy a medium next time and I will have to return the XL as it's way to big for me.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: These are fantastic.  Comfortable, soft, wash well, and sit just right without making any awful underwear lines.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: These are my favorite pair of underwear. I initially bought two pairs to use when hiking and backpacking. I've since bought two more and wear them a lot - they are the first pair I reach for in my drawer. I like the full coverage - no lines across my jean pockets or half wedgies from a smaller cut. They are also comfortable. And I support Patagonia's missions as well as their use of organic cotton.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I take back every bad word I have ever muttered about underwear. Loving them on long trail runs as even my pants/tights/skorts with "built in" underwear chafe. No more of that nonsense. And they're super comfortable to even wear around the office. Pretty sure my disposition has become 50% sunnier since I've started wearing them.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: These underwear are comfortable and soft, and I like the design and cut. Whether I wear them for long backpacking trips, climbing or for a day in town, they are perfect. Will (keep) ordering more!

Purchased for my girlfriend. Great fit, stays in place.
Small fits her perfect.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: simply put...worth every penny! needed underwear that wouldn't ride up for marathon running...and it did the trick!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: These are a great fit and comfortable
Theses are very comfortable and true to size.

These are excellent underwear -- fit great, dry quickly, comfy. All the reviews were so great I had to give them a try. However, I'm not sure what I was expecting ... this is just underwear. I got 'em on sale, not sure it's worth spending the money on full price.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I love these underwear. They are comfortable and very smooth. They don't ride up, nor do they chafe. They're as comfortable in the boardroom as they are in the backcountry. Even better, they're quick drying! I bought one pair and was hesitant because they're more than I usually pay for underwear, but I get such use out of them i bought several more pairs!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: These breathe and stay put - 2 things that apparently are difficult for manufacturers to achieve. They are pricey but are worth it. I wash on gentle in a bag and hang to dry.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: love them! light and quick drying, sit low, don't ride up, don't get wedgies. running in them is a joy, so comfortable and can barely feel them. i have a pair in black color and they are super cute! i'm 5' 2'', 115 lb and XS fits me great. i would get more if they weren't so pricey.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: These are comfortable, fit good, made of nice fabric, but are pretty granny and unflattering in the looks dept. Wish there was an in between these and their low rider bikinis. Oh well. Will wear them when active and not on dates.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: My first impression is very positive--I normally wear Moving Comfort underwear for activity but these are softer and lighter. The fit is great, and I don't think they look like granny pants as some have said, but to each their own! Interested to see how they last. Note: I bought a pair of the Barely Bikini also in M and they felt very small. They went back.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: These do not fit like they look in the photo. they are not hipsters but full coverage. They look dorky and don't work well under most of my pants since I wear lower cut pants. They are comfortable but the material is also a bit strange. Not my favorites by a long shot.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: After 6 years of loyalty to another brand, the Patagonia Barely Hipsters are now officially my new favorite undies.  The fabric feels great on, is super thin and stretchable, but still sturdy.  There's enough coverage to insure you don't end up with panty lines but not so much that they cross the line from cute and functional to purely functional. As other reviewers have said, they stay put.  No riding up, no wedgies, no readjusting even after strenuous activity.  I travel for long periods of time with just 3 pair.  They are so thin that they take up no room in my pack and they easily dry overnight when I hang them out after hand washing.  I wear a small in other brands, and the small in these fits me perfectly. The Deep Plum color is particularly nice.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: This is a nice dress. I bought it for my girlfriend.  Unfortunately, she didn't like the way it fit, so I returned it.

I bought this for my girlfriend here's her review:
This dress won me over. I've never enjoyed wearing dresses but this one is super comfortable. The elastic waistline can fall weird but a simple adjustment sets it right. I'm 5'8" and it hits me just above the knee. Highly recommended, very light weight and comfortable.

Really wanted to love his dress based off of the other reviews. I would have to say that this is not for the large chested woman. It seemed like it would have been super comfortable if it would have fit better.
I love this dress. it fits so great and is very comfortable. Great to wear out on the town or just hanging around.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This dress is cute and easy to wear. Throw it on over anything, the waist cinch adds some figure, and the length is perfect for a coverup or walking town pre/post beach. Soft material, true to size (purchased a Small for size 4/6).

Great colors and design. Fit is nice. Bodice is loose and could be taken in a tad with a saftey pin, but not necessary, as that is style and may be nice for someone with a larger bosom than me. Good length, and I am tall. Nice lightweight material for summer, but also would work well in spring/fall with a sweater and leggings. I have a long torso, and so the waist sits higher than the photo might suggest, but it looks fine, and I don't typically like high waists.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5:
I am 5'8" (135#) and I ordered a S based on past Patagonia dress order experience- I find they tend to run big.

I often have difficulty with waistlines hitting me at the right spot and I would say this is a bit high- just above my belly button- so it ends up looking more like an empire waistline instead.  The elastic waistband provides some shape to it, but if you are long-waisted at all, I would pass.  I don't think going up a size would help since it fits loose around the bootie and the top fits well, too, for a 36C bra size- falls just above the knee on me.  Love the material though!

I kept it and will wear it often, but offering tall sizes would be a bonus!
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: This is the most comfortable dress ever! And still looks cute. I have it in black and the green as well. I like that it can be dressed up or down. Highly recommend!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5:
I dont know if I've tried a dress that patagonia has made that I havent loved.  

I like this dress a whole lot.  I am tall and mostly torso so this dress hits me mid thigh.  The key hole in the back is smaller than I expected based on the picture.
 
Someone with a larger chest than I may have issue with the fit of the dress.  (34 B/C) I just barely fit in the bust. I think if it were any smaller I would be uncomfortable with the way it would look.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: This dress looked really cute in the photos, but runs big and hangs like a night gown. Sadly had to return.

These shorts would be perfect if they were available in my size. Many of the reviews said the shorts ran small and to order up.  I wouldn't agree with that review.  I am a medium and ordered a large thinking they would fit due to some of the reviews.  I ended up returning the shorts because they barely stayed up over my hips.  I would order a medium next time.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: My only complaint is that they tend to run a little small. The smalls are just barely too small but the mediums are too big. Besides that these shorts are awesome! The liner stays in place and the material is on point! I love taking these on weekend camping trips or trail run weekends because they dry so quickly. I recently went on a two week vacation in California and we stayed at camp spots multiple nights and I rinsed them off in the showers or the creek and they were dry the next morning. The waist band is also fantastic. No chaffing, super comfortable and it stays in place. You gotta try out these shorts no matter what your summer plans are, running, hiking, camping or just hanging out in the heat.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: This is my second pair of Nine Trails. Absolutely my favorite running shorts. The relaxed waist band makes these so comfortable - I definitely recommend!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5:
I originally ordered and returned the Strider shorts, since I found them to be cut on the small side.  

I realized when returning the Striders that the Nine Trails shorts were more of what I was looking for:  better coverage 4" vs 3.25" inseam and a zippered pocket!

Since the Strider shorts were snug, I sized up to a large in the 9 Trails (I am typically a medium, size 8)--the waist is a little big, but I like having extra room through the thighs.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: These are the perfect length! My booty is covered but the short isn't too long either. I wear between a size 4 - 6 and tried on the size small in the store. It fit but was in the smaller side, so I ordered a medium instead. I like my running shorts to have some room to bust a move.  It is perfect! I want more!!!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: These shorts are too low rise for me to run in.  If shorts don't come up over my hip bones, they are not going to stay on when I start running!  I guess they'd be ok for casual wear, but I needed running shorts.  I ended up with Marmot Circuit shorts, which worked much better for me.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: Awesome shorts! Perfect for everything. I am 5'8 tall 36" hips usually wear a size 8 pants. I am a definite medium. They are quick dry and I am so glad they don't have the lining for the panties. You won't regret this purchase.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: These are my favorite pair of summer shorts for desert adventures and river floats. They dry quickly, they're super cute, and you have a ton of freedom in them. The shorter inseam is very flattering. Personally, I think the longer inseam baggies balloon out and make my legs look ridiculous. Would recommend for any summer adventures in hot temps or involving water sports!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I knew my sis had a pair of these and loved them, so I snagged another pair for christmas.  She loves them and wont buy another brand.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5:
I have two pairs of these shorts now and soon will have more (pay day is Friday!)(Just kidding I need to save my money).
Initially I was cautious about getting these since I had tried them on before and wasn't impressed with the fit. I've got some junk in the trunk and need a bit more wiggle room. I gave the mediums a try and ended up loving them. Easy to wear and so comfy.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Ive worn them quite a few times in the warmer months on long hikes and backpacking trips - quick drying and functional. They are  much shorter than the original baggies and a bit slimmer through the hip. Im a curvier in that area and it would be more comfortable with a tad more room. My only gripe with these short is the low rise. If we could combine the higher rise of the original baggie and the inseam with the barely baggies then it would be perfect. Over all these are pretty good.

I really like this short, I bought one and after using it I had to buy another one because it is exactly what I was looking for, it dries quickly, and it is versatile I can use it for hiking, canyoning, going to the beach, etc.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I wanted to love these shorts so bad but they just didn't fit me correctly. I didn't try them in a different size because after paying to return them I just didn't want to mess with ordering them online again and will be heading to a store to try them on. There just seemed to be a lot of awkward extra fabric under the waist band that just wasn't flattering on my body. I've purchased quite a bit of Patigonia items and am never let down by the quality but something about the fit was just a bit off on these for me.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5:
The size runs a little large and is baggy in areas I wouldn't normally like but in saying that they are super comfy!! And they're baggy for a reason; so you can do stuff without having to think first. 
I love the colour (HOWLING TURQUOISE), I LOVE the fast dry material. Def recommend these. 
My hips are 100cm (Australian) sooooo 39.3 inches and the large was perhaps a bit big. 
The pockets suck but I purchased the JanSport Waisted Pack and that makes up for it.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I love these shorts and need more.  I wear them all the time whether I'm hiking, camping, and even fly fishing in the super.  I'm always looking for a women's hybrid short and can never find any.  These shorts are a great substitute and not to mention the fun patterns kill it!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I love the turquoise color of these shorts. They are comfortable and have a good amount of give when you move around. I have  a decently size booty and athletic ski thighs and the medium fit just right – any smaller though and I would have swapped for a large.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: Patagonia always pulls through, these shorts are perfect for casual wear / kayaking / beach days / just about anything. I bought two more pairs of these baggies and I still want more. Material is durable and dries super quickly. These are my main staple during the summer time!

I have averaged wearing these shorts at least 3 days per week over the course of this summer, and I (obviously) absolutely love them. VERY durable, dry quickly for those dips in the river or still wet bathing suits, and variety of colors and patterns allows for variety and brings lots of compliments! The only significant downfall is that as stated by previous reviews, the pockets are useless. Treat them as if they are not even there because EVERYTHING falls out of them.
My last comment is that to look at the name of products you buy; in this case, 'Baggies'. They are not meant to look and fit as other shorts out there. When you sit, they become baggy in the front/crotch area. This doesn't bother me at all, but realize this when you go to buy them.
I have  found the size to be true to other brands sizing. I have a more athletic build, so the Large that I bought fits my rear as I would like it too. The tie on the top helps suck in the elastic if you have the slimmer waist as I do. 

Adventure on friends.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I read the reviews and decided to go with larges instead of my normal size which is a medium. These were huge...practically falling off. They were also baggy in all the wrong places with my body-type. I would definitely not wear this size out, let alone out on the trail (or worse, swimming). Hopefully, I'll be able to exchange for a smaller size because I really want to love these. The fabric seems durable yet comfortable and the shorts are surprisingly light weight.

I wanted to love these so much and almost kept them in spite of the strange fit, but decided to keep searching for a water short. The waistband seemed a bit tight and fabric bagged out in the front, just below the waistband, even though they fit well everywhere else. Bummer.

I really do love these shorts to hike in, but the pockets aren't sewn up high enough so make sure to not put anything in your pockets or it will fall out while hiking!  I usually wear XS in Patagonia and got a small in these and they fit great! They dry fast and are lightweight!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Love the material. It's very different than a lot of the other Patagonia shorts. I ordered these in a Medium in the longer baggies and they are way too big. I decided to order a small in these and they fit like spandex. Returning and trying the medium.

These shorts are the best things ever invented! I bought 3 :) I wear them to work, hiking, kayaking or just lounging around on the beach. I normally wear a size 4 in pants. I tried the small fit in store. It fit, but if you really want the comfortable, baggy feel, I recommend the mediums.

I have 2 pairs of these great shorts- I typically wear a medium but sized up to a large in these. The 2 1/2" inseam makes for a great length for us shorter girls. I wear them casually and to hike in- either way the shorts are very functional, dry fast, and look great! Patagonia's product durablility makes this an easy decision to pick up a pair (or two, or three)! I love mine!

column5: I gave these shorts to my Mother as a gift. She really enjoys wearing these comfortable shorts almost all summer. The length is perfect and she likes the material.

column5: Me encantan los uso diariamento, para la piscina, para todo muy comodos  y  suprer livianos  es mi  tercer par :)

Regardless of hiking / travel, etc - they are super comfy and wear beautifully - and wash / dry even better.  Have ordered more and these will be a basic in my undies "department".  (I bought size Large because I'm "hippy" ... fit is very very comfortable - no riding up)
My wife Just bought more! No lines in her yoga pants and that's hard to find.  Comfortable and very light weight.
Pricey but worth it. Great as a bikini cut or active brief.  Perfect for camping as they dry quick with wicking material.
Got these for the wife and if she's happy i'm happy.

column5: So comfortable- great for hikes sports and everyday

column5:
Super super soft and comfy!  Great for wearing under breeches.  True to size.  

I bought another couple pairs of these for riding and very happy with the purchase.  The underwear I received did not have tags on them so no worries there.

column5: Super comfortable! Once you go patagonia you'll never go back
so soft and comfy!  Planning on buying serval more panties. I'm 5'3, 135, and runner/ crossfitter.. so I got a larger back end.

column5: As other reviewers stated, the bikini is low riding.  It also fits well.  I like the fit better than the Ex Officio string bikini.  Works well while working out.

column5:
My anaconda don't want none unless u cover my buns, hun...
( I swear those are lyrics...) 
Seriously just not enough material to keep me from being caught on candid camera via adjustment activities induced by these  rather small garments .  I'm 5'4", 130 lbs, and usually wear a size small... These garments were true to size, just not enough coverage for my liking. Otherwise cute cut in the front, nice low rise action... But otherwise too cheeky, if u catch my drift...

column5: I was a little skeptical when looking at some of the pics of the cut on these, but decided to try them a try anyway based on the good reviews. I should've trusted my gut. These sit really low for bikinis and look goofy and don't stay put (fell down throughout the day). I am not small or young, so that may have something to do with it. I will be returning the second pair. The fabric is nice, at any rate.

column5: I bought these for my girlfriend, and she loved them.  She says she plans to buy more pairs.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: Underwear can be uncomfortably wrong, you know what I mean? Well, never fear with these guys! Super lightweight, quick drying, cute, well-cut, these are by far my favorite underwear yet. I wear them out in the mountains, at college, and at the beach when I've forgotten my swimmers.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: So comfortable and cute.  I normally only wear thongs because I find normal bikini panties ride up but these are amazing.  The fabric is also so thin and comfortable.  I will be buying more !!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I bought several pairs of these panties after learning the hard way that thongs get a little icky out camping or hiking. These bikini underwear have really been an unbelievably better alternative. I suffer from a flat booty, but these still fit great in the small size.  They're very comfortable, and I was able to fit a pantyliner in the gusset when I needed to. The material breathes well, so they don't get damp and bunch or ride up. Totally wedgie free! They're cute and comfortable enough to wear everyday, but I try to keep them set aside for the rough stuff.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: My wife bought these a while ago & she couldn't be happier! They look great, dry fast, & are typical Patagonia quality. Overall Perfect!

These are my favorite underwear by far!  They are comfortable, yet sexy, with great coverage and no panty lines.  I love the lower fit on the hip compared to some other similar styles.  They are super lightweight so dry quickly in the backcountry.  I am slowly building my collection.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: really comfortable and great active wear.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Bought these for my recent hiking trip to Africa (to summit Mt Kilimanjaro!) and safari journey.  These are now my most favorite undies ... period, the end.  Regardless of hiking / travel, etc - they are super comfy and wear beautifully - and wash / dry even better.  Have ordered more and these will be a basic in my undies "department".  (I bought size Large because I'm "hippy" ... fit is very very comfortable - no riding up)
My wife Just bought more! No lines in her yoga pants and that's hard to find.  Comfortable and very light weight.
Pricey but worth it. Great as a bikini cut or active brief.  Perfect for camping as they dry quick with wicking material.
Got these for the wife and if she's happy i'm happy.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: DO NOT BUY. Didn't realize there had been a change in fabric & bought 4 pairs.  No moisture wicking AT ALL. Wore on a hike and chafed in places I didn't know chafing was possible.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: So comfortable- great for hikes sports and everyday
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Patagonia started putting tags on the back of the underwear.  The kind that leaves remnants that will stick you forever. The original version did not have tags. Stay away if you like your skin. They are being returned.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5:
Super super soft and comfy!  Great for wearing under breeches.  True to size.  

I bought another couple pairs of these for riding and very happy with the purchase.  The underwear I received did not have tags on them so no worries there.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Super comfortable! Once you go patagonia you'll never go back
so soft and comfy!  Planning on buying serval more panties. I'm 5'3, 135, and runner/ crossfitter.. so I got a larger back end.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: As other reviewers stated, the bikini is low riding.  It also fits well.  I like the fit better than the Ex Officio string bikini.  Works well while working out.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5:
My anaconda don't want none unless u cover my buns, hun...
( I swear those are lyrics...) 
Seriously just not enough material to keep me from being caught on candid camera via adjustment activities induced by these  rather small garments .  I'm 5'4", 130 lbs, and usually wear a size small... These garments were true to size, just not enough coverage for my liking. Otherwise cute cut in the front, nice low rise action... But otherwise too cheeky, if u catch my drift...
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: I was a little skeptical when looking at some of the pics of the cut on these, but decided to try them a try anyway based on the good reviews. I should've trusted my gut. These sit really low for bikinis and look goofy and don't stay put (fell down throughout the day). I am not small or young, so that may have something to do with it. I will be returning the second pair. The fabric is nice, at any rate.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

These are my favorite underwear by far!  They are comfortable, yet sexy, with great coverage and no panty lines.  I love the lower fit on the hip compared to some other similar styles.  They are super lightweight so dry quickly in the backcountry.  I am slowly building my collection.

column5: really comfortable and great active wear.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I bought these for summer casual use and after wearing them a few times, my sister convinced me she needed them more, and they fit her better.. she loves the way they hug her and the cute design. The size 4 fit me, but I would have ordered a size 6 for a little more room.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: My wife found her new summer go-to in these Patagonia Stretch All-wear 4 inch shorts. The Scorpo/Channel Blue is a great color/pattern that is fits right in on the boat. She reports that these are very comfortable, but that the size 2 is almost too big. She typically wears a size 2 or 26.

I was very hopeful for these shorts, but I had to return them. I am 5'5" 155lbs with a muscular build and a full rump.  After reading the reviews i decided on a size 10. The shorts fit nicely around the waist,almost a little loose, but were too tight around the hips and butt. There was pulling/wrinkling and the pockets stuck out. I didn't order a size up because the waist would have been way too big and would have left a big gap in back.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5:
wore  these for camping; very comfortable. stylish shorts easily dressed with flats or dress sandals. I'm a classic chic so theses are a personal favorite. I definitely recommend them.
I'm a size 6 and they fit awesome.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I have worn these hiking and for casual. They're very comfortable and a good length. I worry a little about ordering pants online because they never seem to fit right. The sizing chart and other reviews helped a lot and were spot on. I ordered a size four and they're perfect. I only wish they came in more colors!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I finally got around to purchasing this style this year and I absolutely love it. A bit sad though that I have been missing out all of this time. It is still a little chilly outside so I have only tried this one indoors, but the fit is great, material is very nice, and stretch is a wonderful addition. I purchased in the Scorpo/Channel Blue, but the material is plenty thick so if you have your eye on the bleach stone I do not think you need to fear that this will be sheer in any way. The shorts are plenty long for coverage. In addition, the sizing chart appears to be spot on. I purchased the size 4 and they fit great. Would be a perfect addition to your summer wardrobe.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: These shorts are literally the comfiest things ever. They are so stretchy that you can move any which way in them. They have the stretchiness of spandex shorts yet have the nice thick material of nice and formal shorts. They are perfect for every camping activity and even just wearing around town because they look nice enough to do so. I loved them so much I bought them in three colors! For reference, I am 135 lbs and 5'8 and the 6 fit great. I tried on the 4's and they fit just as well but I sized up just so the shorts would last me a longer time down the road.
They fit really well and look great. They are perfect for wearing casually as well as active things - fit great under my climbing harness and are comfy to bike in. I wish I could wear them everyday.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I was so excited for these shorts to arrive. They appeared to be cute and functional, and I am a HUGE Patagonia fan. What I'm not a fan of it's Patagonia's inconsistent sizing on bottoms. I can order any top and I know it will fit, but I feel like with bottoms it's hit or miss. I wear an XS in all their running shorts and pants, but as far as casual shorts go I'm anywhere between 0 and a 4. I bought the Island hemp shorts in the spring and the 2 fit perfect--so I assumed a 2 would work with these shorts as well....but they were too big around the waist and baggy on my derrière. As far as look and construction go, they were everything you could expect form Patagonia--awesome. I wish they would have worked.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5:
Finally shorts that fit an active body! 
I have been hard pressed to find shorts that actually flatter my figure! These worked out for me! Long enough to cover my thighs, n giggly bits, and just tight enough to accentuate my assets! Thank you Patagonia for making a short i can both wear to a BBQ, on my bike, or in the office!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Love the cool simple design. I find myself wearing this shirt all the time.
This is a very breathable shirt and it def wicks away moisture. This is my go to hiking shirt.
Great shirt,  get it you won't be disappointed.  Can wear to work or take on a week long backpacking trip. light weight and quick drying, I'm a fan.

Because the El Ray is the most AWESOME of shirts out there! Great fit, though not what I would call a regular fit if I compare this shirt to the puckerware shirts that Patagonia offers. It is just a perfect mix of hot weather comfort and easy care! Dries fast , lightweight, and great for everyday wear! If you don't have this shirt you need one...oh and btw, I bought another in S/S and another on the L/S...highly recommended!

This is a great shirt!  I work with Jimmy Elam and one day found we have the same great taste in clothing as we were both wearing the El Ray in the happy bolders/catalyst blue. At that moment I knew how good I must look in this shirt because he looked pretty sharp.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I switch off wearing the El Ray and Bandito shirts from Patagonia on a daily basis. Seriously, they're the only two shirts that I wear all summer long. One of my favorite things about the El Ray is its wrinkle resistance. One bummer is that the El Ray gets stinky quicker than my Bandito. So, instead of being able to wear it for five days straight like the Bandito, I have to wash it every couple uses. Besides that, the El Ray is an insanely comfortable and bomber shirt that I would be happy wearing on any summer day.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: The thing that I love about this shirt besides the style and quality is that it is made out of mainly nylon.  It's a great shirt for almost any adventure and then can be used as a casual dress shirt with ease. Snap buttons make this easy on and easy off.  Highly recommend this shirt. Goat worthy!!!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: This has a great fit! I have room in the shoulders to move my arms around with out the fabric getting to tight and it allows fantastic freedom of motion. The left breast pocket has the hole for a pen which I love. The material is light and this is a very comfortable shirt. You should get one!
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5:
This shirt is quite soft, smooth and comfort.

I bought when season sale, a good buy. It makes you feel cool, also breathes well.

The shirt is made in China and very well made. So I know that Patagonia has a good quality control system. (Made-in-China could be wonderful but you need to clarify your standards).

I am 178cm/75KG, a M is little trim fit but I know the L will be too baggy.

I will recommend this to my friend.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I've always somewhat hated button up shirts, simply because the buttons are annoying! The El Ray has snap buttons that make life so much better. Originally I ordered an XL but the shirt ended up being way too big. Then I purchased a size L through steep & cheap. Could have gone with a medium, but the large fits great and has a bit more room in the arms. Overall it's an amazing shirt, cool, lightweight, durable and stylish. My only complain is there are only two plaid color options. Hopefully next season there are some more colors to choose from.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Thankfully, I am not covered in yeti fur and need sun protection - enter the El Ray shirt.  These shirts are equally at home in the office, at the bar or on the river and provide UPF that won't wear off.  All Patagonia products are tested independently to meet Australian/New Zealand or AATCC protocols.  Basically, <5% of the suns UV rays pass through the product.  Just a solid shirt that is durable and comfortable.  One tip for longevity, just wash in cold and air dry.  If you are hitting the town, just throw it in the dryer on low for 5 quick minutes and skip the iron.  These shirts are consistent with PAT and bluesign technologies (helping to evaluate and reduce resource consumption in PAT's materials supply chain) ensuring that PAT uses approved chemicals, processes, materials and products that are safe for the environment, safe for workers and safe for the end customer.  Thanks for giving a damn Patagonia - good on ya!
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Pasha from Patagonia talks through the newly redesigned El Rey shirt.  (Possibly named for the great El Ray dive bar in Ventura)

Polygiene permanent odor control stops the growth of odor-causing bacteria on fabrics, so you can Wear More and Wash Less®. Products treated with Polygiene do not need to be washed as often, which saves water, energy, time and money as well as improving the lifespan of the products. 

Odor Free. Climate Smart. bluesign® approved. 
Watch the video to learn more!

I got these thinking that they would be a little closer fit to the regular boxer brief from Patagonia.  I went with the size I always wear in undies, and they seemed to fit pretty snug all around.  Still rocking them, but I have mixed feelings about this cut.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I loved my old versions of these so i decided to get some new ones, sadly the sizing has changed and they are much smaller then in past seasons. It seems as if the cut may have changed a bit as they feel shorter  and overall tighter.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I am a 31 waist and I have multiple pairs of these boxers over the years and I love them. I just ordered a couple more pairs and the sizing has completely changed, they are about 3" shorter than my other pairs and just don't fit the same so I returned them. It seems as if the solid colors fit better but the pattern ones fit completely different. My older pairs are a 5 star so I'm giving these a 3 but it is unfortunate as I don't want to order any more due to sizing changes and the length of them now.
Fits great and is soft
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: These were maybe an inch shorter than I thought they would be, but they're still very comfy!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Lightweight and breathable boxers for daily use.  Comfortable waistband and leg fit.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I have a few pairs of the capilene version from previous years on these so i thought i'd try the cotton version. I like them, pretty simple clean pair of briefs. Patagonia shortened up the leg inseem on them compared to past versions but the sizing on these is still quite good, and for some reason they fit about a size bigger then the most recent Capilene boxer briefs but that's  a good thing as these are true to size.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: no complaints, prefer slightly longer legs but love these regardless
Fits great  nice material
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: The cotton blend fabric is very comfortable and all in all these are good boxer briefs.  I wish the leg length was maybe an inch longer.  As it is these seem to ride up a bit on me because of how they hit my legs.  The waist size is spot on but probably should have purchased a size up.  Otherwise would easily have given them another star.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Got this as a gift for my husband, loves this boxer because of the fabric and fit.  I'll be buying more of these as gifts.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I use them when I go hiking, and they perform great!  They do feel a bit larger than expected.
Excellent quality and the organic has great feel. I wear these every day.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: Order one or two sizes up!

Bought this as a gift for my friend because I thought they looked really cool and seemed like very sturdy pants. I thought they would be great for him for outdoor activities like climbing because they were a bit looser on the legs. However, this was actually the downfall for him because he thought they were too airy and open for climbing. He is pretty slim though which could contribute to the issue. He did have to size up.
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: I based my size choice on other shorts purchase on this sight. I bumped up one size based on the feedback I saw on size and it was not enough. I own Patagonia  baggies small and they fit great. Most other shorts size 30 waist fir great. 31s are usually baggie. I can’t button the stand up shorts. I owned this short 30 years ago and wore them to sherds. They were my favorites. Comfortable, durable and versatile allowing easy movement. I don’t know why the size is such an issue. I’m very disappointed.

I had a bad feeling when I ordered these. I have slim thighs to start so I am always swimming in shorts, but these things were flared out like a skirt.  There must have been 10 inches of additional fabric on each leg. If Jncos made shorts this would be the pattern they follow. I liked the length but couldn't get around the excess space in the leg.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: I snagged 2 pairs of these at the beginning of summer and have loved them. I debated between the 7 and 5in inseam and went with the bold 5 in. They fit me better and show off these wonderful legs my Momma gave me.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I have bought Patagonia gear for many years. My recent purchase was not a disappointment. Thanks for carrying such outstanding merchandise.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I bought this pair for work and got exactly what I expected. They are nice enough to get by whether at work or boppin' around town. The only complaint that I have so far - the material is a little heavy for those hot days, but you can't win them all! I would highly recommend this pair of shorts.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: So I read a lot of the reviews before purchasing these shorts (shout to Trev Lawson for his sweet review). I was expecting them to be smaller than sized and they are def snug. I was expecting the legs to flare out some (I think one review said like cut off version of jnco jeans from the 90's which is accurate and hilarious). I was NOT expecting the back pockets to be so ugly! They are cut like the front of a pair of jeans. It looks weird and dumb. And it's not so much a critique of the shorts themselves but more to Backcountry who has zero pics on the site. I don't recommend, the legs flaring out is worse than expected too. Don't recommend:(

I am hoping this pair lasts as long.  These shorts stand up to some heavy lifting, especially the pockets which are deep and functional.  The material is comfortable from the start and you know it is going to last.  I am thrilled Patagonia is still making these classics!
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I have great legs for a dude; chicks love these tree trunks. I usually wear Chubbies shorts, but the material wears out a bit quicker than you want a $50 pair of shorts to. The stand-up shorts are like 3x thicker in terms of the fabric itself with what seems to be an enforced crotch area to deal with that chub-rub. The pocket sitch is a weird one, but you can carry all of your things and not look like a total doofus. My only qualm, and that's why these puppies are getting a 4/5, is the waist sizing. I'm a tried and true 31"ish and went up to a 32" because that's what was available. These guys are tight, not like "suck in the gut" tight, but like a "don't wash or dry on hot" tight. I would have rocked the 33" if it was available, but I could only find those on Patagonia's website. I would have done that, but BackCountry hooked me up with a coupon. I'll know for next time. Either way, these things have held up to 6 nights of heavy drinking downtown Nashville and got me two phone numbers from a bachelorette party, so I'll live with em.
column8: I've used it several times

column5:
One thing's for sure, you can't go wrong with this short. The canvas fabric is durable and lends a classic look - not to mention, those pockets! Can't get enough of them. The hubs owns two pairs, one with a 28 waist and another in a 30 waist and just about lives in them come summer - basically waffling between his Baggies, running shorts, and the Stand-Up shorts. He does agree that these fit a little more snug (in the waist) than the average 29 / 30 waist, hence owning the two different size options. The thighs do flare out, but they're not offensively large by any means (granted, that's my opinion). For size reference, he's 135lbs, 5'9" and wears a Small in Patagonia bottoms and wears a 29 in Levi's.

And while I know there's a version out there for women, I bought a pair of the men's 28 waist, 5in inseam for myself and they fit great. I often like the fit of the men's shorts a little more, especially when they feature a classic rise. The rise hits my natural waist and is a shade relaxed, but super comfy. The fit in the legs is super comparable to my beloved, classic Baggies, which I much prefer in comparison to the tight fit of most women's shorts. I'd rather not waste my time yanking on my shorts. So, ladies, if you like the fit of the classic baggies, the Stand-Up short (in 5in) is well-worthy a try.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Picked up a pair of these recently and am very impressed. They feel a little snug at first, but loosen up within a few minutes. Fairly short shorts and because of this compression shorts show when I sit down. The organic cotton is good too very soft against the skin. The real key to these pants is their durability. They really stand up to anything you can throw at them. The button is metal and the stitching is strong. The only thing i don't like is the Velcro back pockets. I don't really have an issue with this, but i think a more durable choice would have been metal snap closures since Velcro will wear out with heavy use. I never use the back pockets mainly because the front ones are extremely spacious.
column8: I've used it several times

column5:
I figured I would write a review while I am online returning these shorts. I am 5'11'' 150lbs. Normally I wear a 30" waist, sometimes a 31" waist in everything. I originally ordered these in a 30x5 and I am 3" shy of even getting them buttoned. I am returning them to the great people at backcountry for a 32x5 and I think that will still be a tight fit, but I can't go to 34x5. 
Why 5 stars? These are awesome and I cannot wait to get a size back that fits!! The material was great, the legs were roomy (without being clown shorts), and the craftsmanship is up to par with Patagonia standards. 
Late February in MN and I will have the right size back by the weekend! I love you, Backcountry!
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: I am fond of saying that if I wanted to wear shorts that touch my knees, I would wear pants.  The 7" inseam is perfect for my needs. I have owned several pairs of these over the years and I will continue to buy them as they wear out every decade or so.  Simple, tough, well-constructed, comfortable and they are great for everyday use on and off the trail.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5:
High quality shorts that were exactly what I'd expect from Patagonia.  I had to end up returning them due to the fit, but overall these were top notch.

A note on sizing - I have a 35" waist and usually wear size 34-36, but the 36" waist in this short was easily 3 inches too small.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: Great Shorts for anytime outdoors activity.  However, if you are shy about showing your thigh's then I wouldn't recommend purchasing the 5 inch versions .  But , seeing as my thighs are glorious and have humbled greek gods , they accent my lifestyle nicely.

The Stand Up Short is incredibly comfortable and I love the 5" inseam option. Too many of the shorts I find online and in stores have long inseams that run down to the knees and while there's nothing wrong with this inseam length, I prefer to have a short that is on the shorter side of things for hiking and relaxing. 

The only issue I have with these shorts is that the waist size is not normal. I ordered a 32" waist, which always fits me in all brands, and these were WAY too tight. I had to order up 2" to a 34" to get them to fit properly. I even have 32" pants from Patagonia that fit fine, so I'm not sure why the waist is so small on these!

Take my advice and order a couple inches larger on the waist than you normally would and feel awesome rocking these for years to come on the trails and on the sidewalks, too.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I don't have any doubts about the fabled durability of the Patagonia Stand Up Short. The material feels like soft steel forged in the fires of Mordor and the construction is obviously designed to reinforce high impact areas. But I can't really figure why the thighs are so large. Combined with the funny pocket set up(again I recognize this is more about function than style) they literally look like JNCO decided to make short shorts. All it's missing is some psuedo-urban tag patch on the back. If you have big thighs these are definitely the shorts for you. If you have medium or small thighs these will be highly unflattering.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5:
These are sturdy and the 5" inseam could be perfect for not having to cuff them BUT they are SO incredibly loose in the leg.

I have tiny little get-away-sticks but these look like a skirt on me.

I was so frustrated with their look that I gave them to my neighbor, a bicyclist with massive trunk-like legs that are ripped to shreds and he has the exact same complaint.

If you buy them, plan your underwear accordingly.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: I bought these as a gift for my father in law and he couldn't be more pleased.  These have been his favorite pair of shorts for the last few years and he is always wanting a new pair.  He wears them almost everyday so it isn't surprising they are the ideal gift!
column8: I gave it as a gift but have feedback to share

column5: I love the fit of this short and the stretch fabric makes them really comfortable for summer activities.  I normally wear a 32" waist but a 33" in these fits me like a normal 32.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: I've worn nothing but hybrids for water activities for 15+ years, and in the water all the time.  First off black = grey.  Most importantly, the waist just didn't look right, like I was 20lbs heavier compared to other shorts (my wife baulked at them, and I am rather fit).  On top of that, the mesh from the pockets are exposed (the normal material doesn't go down deep enough), so you can see skin.  Really wanted to like them, but they are poorly designed.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5: I've worn these shorts a few times, most recently on a three-day camping trip. I wore the same pair all three days. They were extremely comfortable in the muggy heat (80*), in the rain, and in the cooler (72*) days that followed. The material is perfect for all conditions. It barely feels like you're wearing anything! I have to get a few more pairs. Only issue I ran into was the sizing. I'm usually a 32. The 33s were too tight so I returned and got 34s. The 34s are a little loose but with a belt and the cord in the waste to tie off, they're very comfortable.
column8: I've used it once or twice and have initial impressions

column5: Until last year I never would have thought I'd wear nylon stretch pants but I now have several pairs.  They are for casual use but they stay cool, are easy to clean and the don't get creased like cotton ones.
column8: I've used it several times

column5: Great shorts, but 'Ink Black' is really dark grey. 5 stars if they were really black.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5: I'm currently deployed to Bangkok and needed a light short that wasn't too tight or too baggy (I'm 40 and don't like today's skinny fit), that didn't need a belt, and could handle the humidity and sudden downpours we get in Thailand (these repel water). I have two pairs and they have been fantastic walking around the city and at the beach. Pockets are a good size and are mesh to let sand out. Other reviewer is right that drawstring is on the short side but it doesn't bother me as I don't want long strings bunching up.  I'm 6'0 at 165lbs and the 33 fits perfect.
column8: I've used it several times

column5:
I have last year's version of these shorts and they are great. Unfortunately Patagonia changed a few things on this year's version that I think are a regression in functionality. 3 issues were enough for me to return these. 
(1) The draw string is absurdly short...to the point that I'd have to tie a square knot in these to secure them.
(2) The elastic key fob/lanyard is missing...so no way to take a surf /water key.
(3) They switched from a button fly to a zipper fly...just not a fan.
Admittedly these items may not be an issue for most folks who may just use these as casual shorts. However, I rely on these for casual attire, flat-water paddling and (as advertised) impromptu surf session. So they're a no-go unfortunately.  Will look elsewhere brand wise for a hybrid short for this year.
column8: I returned this product before using it

column5:
Fellows, the new age of shorts is here and now.   IF you want a pair of shorts that one ups the money maker and puts your good side on another level, then these are the shorts for you.   Your milkshake is gonna bring all the girls to the yard, and then some.

Don't get me started on the the flexibility.  I bend like a pretzel....and I ll tell you what these shorts kept up with my every move.   Never even had to worry about losing a plum or two out the bottom.   

Hands. Down. 5. Stars.

The style is nice and functional, with great pockets and good quality fabrics--as usual with Patagonia.

Cute shorts, substantial fabric with good stretch, good pockets.  I fell between sizes, though, so had to return.  8 fit best in the butt and waist but the legs were weirdly tight.  10 fit well in the legs but the waist was too big - and it gapped in both sizes.  I'm hoping the next version of these shorts will have a better cut.

The length is perfect for me and might be a little long for those with shorter legs but I am about 5'11'' with long legs and I definitely wouldn't want anything longer than this. So many people keep asking me what shorts these are because they're so rad! You should buy these because they rock, patagonia rocks and you rock.

column5: The Patagonia Wavefarer Stand-Up Short takes an updated approach to the classic canvas Stand Up Shorts by constructing them in their durable, yet quick drying Wavefarer Board Short material. With belt loops and ample pockets to hold everything you need, these are great shorts for everyday wear. The bonus with these shorts is that they can also be worn as board shorts - there is a handy drawstring inside the waist to ensure that they stay up even after you've taken off your belt. Fit is true to size.
column8: I've put it through the wringer

column5:
Good stitch quality, deep, useful pockets, and built tough.  I like that these are quality outdoor shorts that don't look overly cargo-ish.   I wear a 34, ordered a 34, and fit is just right.  A hair loose, but not baggy, and the draw-string allows for a perfect fit without always having to have a belt.   Love how the back pockets result in a double layer seat, and the zipper rear pocket works as a stuff sack.   Glad to see such a versatile version of the board short with all the comfort, but also suitable for camping, fishing, kayaking, beach, and downtown casual.  

I find the buttons to work fine.  Perhaps not as easy as a zipper, but this button design will last for decades.  Every zippered short I have eventually wore out, and I tend to wear things like this for decades if they last.   I think these will certainly last, and are a good value for how I am using them.

For some reason unknown to mankind the designers decided to use only two buttons, instead of three or four, or the common zipper. This means that each time you go for number 1, you have to pull the shorts ALL the way down! Why on earth...

Perfect for a day in the outdoors. These are extremely comfortable, They fit true to size around the waist, however they do fit regular(not slim) around the thigh like most other Patagonia shorts. A go to hiking short that will do well when wet.

Title says it all - these are my go-to short, for any occasion.

They're fast drying and lightweight, so they are great for kayaking or SUP; even when they're wet, they don't bunch up like other shorts or become uncomfortable.  Because they're lightweight, they keep you cool all day - I've put them thru some of the hottest days down south.

They hold up to Patagonia's "worn wear" claim. The stitching is strong, the material is strong as well so they don't rip or tear from snags on the trial.

The fit is very comfortable, I wear a 34 and they are just a little loose on me, but there is a drawstring on the inside that helps tighten them up with ease.

I bought a pair of these for my husband and this is what he had to say: 

"I own a pair of Nine Trails with the built in spandex liner and I like the fit of the shorts themselves but, admittedly don't love the built in compression shorts. So I got myself a pair of the unlined ones figuring I'd wear them mostly as casual shorts and less as running shorts. Well, I was wrong about that because when they're paired with the [baselayer like] Capilene Daily Boxer Briefs (because of the shorter inseam) they're crazy comfortable. I just ordered a pair of Saxx boxers that I anticipate will be even better with these for while running.

As for the shorts, they're a great fit. The pockets seem to be smaller on the unlined version than the lined version, but I could be wrong. I'm really digging these for runs, wearing casually, and worn when sleeping... so, I guess that explains why I haven't really found a reason to take them off yet."

I like that the material isn't too light that it flops around while you running, like other running shorts, but it isn't to heavy as to be too warm. The DWR treatment is amazing and wicks away sweat and rain for a great feel while running. Highly recommend these shorts for any running. I mostly trail run but know they would be a great pair of active shorts in general.

column5: I ordered two pairs of these (khaki, ink black) a couple of weeks ago, and I haven't stopped wearing them in rotation since. So comfortable, with just enough stretch to move in, but not so much that they lose shape after multiple wears. No weird wrinkles, either, which is always a pet peeve of mine. The inseam is perfect -- like my favorite trail running shorts -- and the tie/button closure is comfortable without getting caught on anything. They're generally true to size (for what's listed on the Patagonia size chart) -- I was worried initially, as I have pretty muscular legs. The khaki seems to fit a bit more snugly than the ink black, so more of the slight pocket bulge issue that others have noticed, but they're still great and not too tight/don't ride up. Pockets are deep enough for lots of dog poop bags and keys, or trail snacks -- they'll stretch to fit. I should note that the ink black is not a true black, but more of a dark charcoal, which is what I wanted anyways. These will be perfect for all my desert dirtbagging for a while to come. Worth it to pay more, too, to have a lifetime guarantee from an ethical company.
